over the Wanda bomb DFM country 144
Angola I say BOM dia because this is a
Portuguese speaking nation with so much
life in character that nobody really
knows about why Angola went through a
long and brutal civil war from 1975 to
2002 and until now that's the reputation
the country has but there's so much more
to the story and a thriving life does
exist here up until six months ago
Angola was one of the hardest countries
to visit because the government nearly
blocked tourism but now a new visa makes
life super easy to get in it's surreal
to be in a place that much of the
outside world doesn't know about but I
love it a local friend who I met through
social media
jos√©e has been showing me around the
capital of Luanda which is home to about
one-third of angola's 28 million people
Luanda is a city of contrasts a city of
surprises just casually a fire in the
trash over here so we just walked
through an entire market and it ends at
the sea right here this monument behind
me was started by the Soviets in 1982
and completed by the North Koreans
in 2012 there's a long coastline of
beautiful beach alongside crazy busy
streets with police patrolling on every
block at times I feel safe other times I
feel unsafe let's just say I get a lot
of attention on the streets because
people are not used to seeing tourists
every corner you look is something
different people selling anything they
can get their hands on like bananas or
t-shirts you can find shoe shiners and
car walkers working on sidewalks
directly under modern skyscrapers there
are plenty of nice cars on the roads
like expensive nice yet most of the
houses are shanties like you see here
what I quickly realize is that you
either have money or you don't there is
not much of a middle ground
Angola's economy has grown rapidly over
the last few decades this
skyline changed very rapidly because of
the discovery of oil but its
infrastructure hasn't been able to keep
up resulting in luanda being the world's
most expensive city for expats and
tourists more on that in another video I
kind of like the fact that nobody knows
anything about this country because it
makes discovering everything more
interesting and exciting I cannot wait
to tell you more stories inside this
hidden country called Angola I'm drew
Ben ski and if you like my travel videos
please click Subscribe and join me as I
plan to visit every country in the world
